titleInfo.title: [Letter] 1804 Aug. 5, Knoxville, [Tennessee, to] Colonel [Return Jonathon] Meigs / [John Sevier]: a machine-readable transcription of an image

mods.abstract: This document is a letter written to Cherokee agent Colonel Return J. Meigs from Tennessee Governor John Sevier (1796-1801, 1803-1809) on August 5, 1804. The letter states that commissioners from Tennessee and Georgia are to meet on the fifteenth of that month in order to make arrangements for a road connecting the two states to be run through the Cherokee Nation. Sevier asks Colonel Meigs to notify the Indian Chiefs of this meeting and to also let the Georgian commissioners know that the Tennessee commissioners may be late.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: This MODS record was generated into MODS v3.5 from the TEI teiHeader by University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives, using a stylesheet available at https://github.com/utkdigitalinitiatives/tei-to-mods.
